lawnlayer

Class Level

    • lawnlayer.Level

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Level

        public Level(App app,
             java.lang.String filePath,
             double goal,
             processing.data.JSONArray enemiesJSON)
        Constructs a level object and initialises variables such as goal, Trail, and enemies.
        Parameters:
        app - the Papplet object
        filePath - filePath to the levels.txt file
        goal - from the config.json file, how much of the level must be covered in grass to win
        enemiesJSON - from the config.json file, a JSONArray containing enemy information

    • Method Detail

      • renderLevel

        public void renderLevel()
        The primary method which runs the game, rendering each material and their PImage at the correct spot on PApplet and updating enemies every frame. This method also contains the win condition for the level.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Updates the Trail object which deals with green paths along the map. Note that it only appends a new tile once the player has completely moved to another tile. Called every frame, but only after the player has been updated.

      • getMaterialPixel

        public Material getMaterialPixel(int x,
                                 int y)
        Returns the material underneath a specific pixel coordinate (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - the x value of the player in pixels
        y - the y value of the player in pixels
        Returns:
        the material underneath the player at (x, y)

      • updateMaterialMatrix

        public void updateMaterialMatrix(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 Material material)
        Updates the object (Level.materialMatrix) used to render every tile onto the map every frame with a specific material at a specific coordinate. Note that these coordinates refer to the initial position (top-left) of the sprite, not the centre.
        Parameters:
        x - the sprite x-coordinate to update
        y - the sprite y-coordinate to update
        material - the material to place at these pixels

      • returnMaterialTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> returnMaterialTiles(Material material)
        Returns an ArrayList of all the coordinates in the map which are of type material. Note that the coordinates returned are sprite coordinates.
        Parameters:
        material - material we want the coordinates of
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of int[2] containing x and y coordinates

      • getSurroundingCoords

        public int[][][] getSurroundingCoords(int x,
                                      int y)
        Given a sprite coordinate (x, y), this method returns the sprite coordinates for all 8 surrounding tiles.
        Parameters:
        x - the sprite x-coordinate of the centre tile
        y - the sprite y-coordinate of the centre tile
        Returns:
        a matrix of int[] with the coordinates of all 9 positions related to the chosen tile

      • getNearestSurroundingCoords

        public int[][][] getNearestSurroundingCoords(int x,
                                             int y)
        Given a sprite coordinate (x, y), this method returns the MINIMUM coordinates to move to reach an adjacent tile.
        Parameters:
        x - the sprite x-coordinate of the centre tile
        y - the sprite y-coordinate of the centre tile
        Returns:
        a matrix of int[] with the coordinates of all 8 adjacent positions

      • createMaterialsMatrix

        public Material[][] createMaterialsMatrix(int[][][] coordsArray)
        Given an array of surrounding coordinates the method converts the array to a matrix containing the material on each tile. coordsArray should be either NearestSurroundingCoords or SurroundingCoords
        Parameters:
        coordsArray - Either NearestSurroundingCoords or SurroundingCoords
        Returns:
        A MaterialsMatrix consisting of 8 surrounding tiles

      • materialAt

        public Material materialAt(Material[][] materialArray,
                           int position)
        An extension of createMaterialsMatrix, this method returns the material at any specified direction 1 - 9, corresponding to NW through SE.
        Parameters:
        materialArray - a materialsMatrix
        position - 1 - 9, directional indicators which each correspond to a position in the matrix
        Returns:
        the material in the materialsMatrix at the specified position

      • checkReflectivityAt

        public boolean checkReflectivityAt(Material[][] materialArray,
                                   int position)
        A small method which allows Enemy.checkReflections() to be written more succinctly; essentially checks whether the material is grass or concrete, both materials which enemies can reflect off.
        Parameters:
        materialArray - materialMatrix created using NearestSurroundingCoords
        position - 1 - 9, directional indicators which each correspond to a position in the matrix
        Returns:
        true if the material is either grass or concrete

      • checkOppositionAt

        public boolean checkOppositionAt(Material[][] materialArray,
                                 int cornerPosition)
        A method which allows which allows Enemy.checkReflections() to be written more succinctly; checks whether all 3 corner pieces are concrete or grass.
        Parameters:
        materialArray - materialMatrix created using NearestSurroundingCoords
        cornerPosition - either 1, 3, 7 or 9
        Returns:
        true if all 3 corner pieces are either concrete or grass

      • getMaterialTilesTouched

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getMaterialTilesTouched(Material material,
                                                          int x,
                                                          int y)
        Using a combination of getMaterialTilesTouched(), getNearestSurroundingCoords(), and createMaterialsMatrix(), this method returns the sprite coordinates of all the tiles surrounding (x, y) of a certain material.
        Parameters:
        material - material to check
        x - sprite x-coordinate to check surrounds of
        y - sprite y-coordinate to check surrounds of
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of coordinates of material-tiles touching (x, y)

      • recursiveReplaceMaterial

        public boolean recursiveReplaceMaterial(int[] tile,
                                        Material oldMaterial,
                                        Material newMaterial)
        A recursive flood-fill method to replace every tile of a specific material surrounding a certain tile with another material. The flood-fill stops when it encounters a material that isn't newMaterial. This method is primarily used to to replace all green tiles with red tiles when an enemy hits the player's trail.
        Parameters:
        tile - initial tile coordinates from which to begin the flood fill algorithm
        oldMaterial - the material you want to replace
        newMaterial - the material you want to replace the oldMaterial with
        Returns:
        true on success

      • rReplaceMaterialStored

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> rReplaceMaterialStored(int[] tile,
                                                         Material oldMaterial,
                                                         Material newMaterial)
        Similar to recursiveReplaceMaterial(), except this time it also returns an array containing the coordinates of every tile the flood fill algorithm has reached.
        Parameters:
        tile - initial tile coordinates from which to begin the flood fill algorithm
        oldMaterial - the material you want to replace
        newMaterial - the material you want to replace the oldMaterial with
        Returns:
        true on success

      • getPercentageGrass

        public double getPercentageGrass()

      • getGoal

        public double getGoal()

      • resetRenderCount

        public void resetRenderCount()

      • getEnemyArray

        public Enemy[] getEnemyArray()

      • getInitialSoilTiles

        public java.util.ArrayList<int[]> getInitialSoilTiles()
